com.nhn.android.maps

Class NMapItemizedOverlay

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nhn.android.maps.NMapOverlay
      • com.nhn.android.maps.NMapItemizedOverlay
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    NMapPOIdataOverlay

    public abstract class NMapItemizedOverlay
extends NMapOverlay
    A base class for an NMapOverlay which consists of a list of NMapOverlayItems. This handles sorting north-to-south for drawing, creating span bounds, drawing a marker for each point, and maintaining a focused item. It also matches screen-taps to items, and dispatches Focus-change events to an optional listener.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

    • Constructor Detail

      • NMapItemizedOverlay

        public NMapItemizedOverlay(android.graphics.drawable.Drawable defaultMarker)
        Create a new NMapItemizedOverlay. Note that you will need to add bounds to the marker in order for it to draw correctly. Typically this is done with boundCenterBottom, as in super(boundCenterBottom(marker)).
        Parameters:
        defaultMarker - A Drawable to be drawn on the map for each item in the overlay

    • Method Detail

      • createItem

        protected abstract NMapOverlayItem createItem(int idx)
        Method by which subclasses create the actual Items. This will only be called from populate(); we'll cache them for later use.
        Parameters:
        idx - item index in this overlay

      • size

        public abstract int size()
        The number of items in this overlay. Called once during populate(), and saved for all time.

      • getItemBounds

        public android.graphics.Rect getItemBounds(NMapOverlayItem item)
        Get bounds of the specified item in screen coordinates.

      • getIndexToDraw

        protected int getIndexToDraw(int drawingOrder)
        Returns the rank of the item with the given index. By default, the items are ranked by added order. Subclasses may override this method in order to change the drawing order.

      • draw

        public void draw(android.graphics.Canvas canvas,
                 NMapView mapView,
                 boolean shadow)
        Draw a marker on each of our items. populate() must have been called first. The marker will be drawn twice for each Item in the Overlay--once in the shadow phase, skewed and darkened, then again in the non-shadow phase. The bottom-center of the marker will be aligned with the geographical coordinates of the Item. The order of drawing may be changed by overriding the getIndexToDraw(int) method. An item may provide an alternate marker via its OverlayItem.getMarker(int) method. If that method returns null, the default marker is used. The focused item is drawn at drawFocusedItem() to put it visually on top of the other items. Overrides: draw() in class NMapOverlay
        Overrides:
        draw in class NMapOverlay
        Parameters:
        canvas - The Canvas upon which to draw. Note that this may already have a transformation applied, so be sure to leave it the way you found it.
        mapView - the MapView that requested the draw. Use NMapView.getMapProjection() to convert between on-screen pixels and latitude/longitude pairs.
        shadow - If true, draw the shadow layer. If false, draw the overlay contents.

      • drawFocusedItem

        public void drawFocusedItem(android.graphics.Canvas canvas,
                            NMapView mapView,
                            boolean shadow)
        Draw the focused item to put it visually on top of the other items.
        Overrides:
        drawFocusedItem in class NMapOverlay
        Parameters:
        canvas - The Canvas upon which to draw. Note that this may already have a transformation applied, so be sure to leave it the way you found it.
        mapView - the MapView that requested the draw. Use NMapView.getMapProjection() to convert between on-screen pixels and latitude/longitude pairs.
        shadow - If true, draw the shadow layer. If false, draw the overlay contents.
        See Also:
        NMapOverlay.drawFocusedItem(Canvas, com.nhn.android.maps.NMapView, boolean)

      • getLatSpanE6

        protected int getLatSpanE6()
        Returns:
        the Latitude span of the overlay, computed during populate() as the difference between the northernmost and southernmost Items.

      • getLonSpanE6

        protected int getLonSpanE6()
        Returns:
        the Longitude span of the overlay, computed during populate() as the difference between the westernmost and easternmost Items.

      • getBoundsE6

        protected android.graphics.Rect getBoundsE6()
        Returns:
        the bounds of all items in GRS coordinates multiplied by 1E6, computed during populate().

      • populate

        protected final void populate()
        Utility method to perform all processing on a new NMapItemizedOverlay. Subclasses provide Items through the createItem(int) method. The subclass should call this as soon as it has data, before anything else gets called.

      • updateMarkerForItem

        protected void updateMarkerForItem(NMapOverlayItem item)

      • setLastFocusedIndex

        protected void setLastFocusedIndex(int lastFocusedIndex)
        Set the index of the item that was most recently (or currently) focused, or -1 if none ever was. This is remembered so that nextFocus(boolean) can resume sequential browsing of an NMapOverlay even if the user pans away momentarily. Ordinarily subclasses will not need to set this variable, since it will be automatically updated when the focus is changed.

      • setFocus

        protected void setFocus(NMapOverlayItem item)
        If the given Item is found in the overlay, force it to be the current focus-bearer. Any registered ItemizedOverlay.OnFocusChangeListener will be notified. This does not move the map, so if the Item isn't already centered, the user may get confused. If the Item is not found, this is a no-op. You can also pass null to remove focus.

      • nextFocus

        protected NMapOverlayItem nextFocus(boolean forwards)
        Returns the next Item to be focused in the given direction, or null if we're at the end of the line. If we've never been focused before, returns the first item, or null if we're empty.

      • onTap

        public boolean onTap(int px,
                     int py,
                     NMapView mapView)
        Handle a tap event. A tap will only be handled if it lands on an item, and you have overridden onTap(int) to return true. Overrides: onTap in class NMapOverlay
        Overrides:
        onTap in class NMapOverlay
        Returns:
        true if the tap was handled by this overlay.

      • hitTest

        protected boolean hitTest(NMapOverlayItem item,
                          android.graphics.drawable.Drawable marker,
                          int hitX,
                          int hitY)
        See if a given hit point is within the bounds of an item's marker. Override to modify the way an item is hit tested. The hit point is relative to the marker's bounds. The default implementation just checks to see if the hit point is within the touchable bounds of the marker.

      • onTap

        protected boolean onTap(int index)
        Override this method to handle a "tap" on an item. This could be from a touchscreen tap on an onscreen Item, or from a trackball click on a centered, selected Item. By default, does nothing and returns false.

        Set whether or not to draw the focused item. The default is to draw it, but some clients may prefer to draw the focused item themselves.
